Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Michael James
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for about $25 dollars after my smart phone's motherboard fried on me.....Out the box, it does its duties, text messaging, recieving and taking calls and even some decent web browsing (decent as far as an older phone can get)...After a little over a month, I started noticing freezes and some serious lag...So much to the point where I've literally missed calls because it had rang multiple times before the call was actually "recieved" on the phone.With all that being said, I still cant say this was a bad purchase. I was in a situation where I could not be without a phone and it helped me out during that. I guess what I can say is, if you're looking for a long run phone....look elsewhere. But if you're like me, and your phone has broken and you're in need of a phone this week or asap just to do the fundamentals...then yeah, this would be a good short term buy. I'd keep a phone like this around just for backup. Waiting for a phone seems really long when you have to order one
